sentences.en: A stray dog was cringing by the door.
sentences.cn: 一条流浪狗畏缩在门旁。

sentences.en: But just the thought of mentioning it to her made him cringe.
sentences.cn: 可是一想到要向她表明这一想法,他就会犹豫、退缩.

sentences.en: By the cringe, it's cold out here.
sentences.cn: 哎呀, 外面这里真冷.

sentences.en: Did you cringe watching some of your tanturms?
sentences.cn: 你自己看那些发怒的场景的时候畏缩过 吗 ?

sentences.en: He abandoned every particle of self - respect cringe and fawn.
sentences.cn: 他把 自尊心 丢得一干二净.

sentences.en: His way of sleeping makes me cringe.
sentences.cn: 他睡觉的方式令我生厌.

sentences.en: I cringe when I think of the risks I took.
sentences.cn: 当我想到我承担的风险时,我也会害怕.

sentences.en: I cringe with embarrassment when I reread those first stories I wrote.
sentences.cn: 我重读了我初期编写的故事,感到十分难为情.

sentences.en: It may be difficult to believe, but some people actually cringe when an opportunity presents itself.
sentences.cn: 令人难以置信的是, 有些人竟在机遇来临时畏缩.

sentences.en: Natives will cringe and squirm with embarrassment at such brashness.
sentences.cn: 对于这种轻率鲁莽,当地人会因尴尬而战战兢兢.坐立不安.

sentences.en: People often cringe when they hear the word fat. That may be because they misunderstand it.
sentences.cn: 大家听到“脂肪”两个字常畏惧退却, 可能是因为他们对脂肪有误解.

sentences.en: That is why some economists cringe when Wall Street firms are bailed out.
sentences.cn: 这也就是一些经济学家,对救助华尔街企业感到厌烦的原因.

sentences.en: They be impulsive, faithful and take risks others may cringe from.
sentences.cn: 在其他人畏缩的时候,他们可以为情所驱, 忠实的承担风险.

sentences.en: They can be impulsive , faithful and take risks others may cringe from.
sentences.cn: 在其他畏缩的时期,他们可能为所驱, 敦朴的担当风险.

sentences.en: Those two words in the title might have made you cringe.
sentences.cn: 标题中的这两个字可能会吓你一跳.

sentences.en: Your foolish talk makes me cringe.

trans.tran_cn: 畏缩, 阿谀, 奉承
trans.tran_en: to move away from someone or something because you are afraid

trans.tran_cn: 畏缩，卑躬屈膝，觉得难为情
